conclusion: The rod PQ moves to the right with speed v in a downward-directed magnetic field B.
The motional emf ε is calculated as ε = B L v = (1.0 T)(1.0 m)(2 m s⁻¹) = 2 V.
The circuit resistance equals the rod’s resistance plus the external resistor.
The total resistance R_total is calculated as R_total = r + R = 1 Ω + 3 Ω = 4 Ω.
The induced current magnitude is calculated as I = ε / R_total = 2 V / 4 Ω = 0.50 A.
Using the right-hand rule (v to the right, B downward), the induced emf drives positive charge from P toward Q.
The current in the external resistor flows from b to a (i.e., upward through the resistor).
